Open wounds contaminated with tetanus bacteria (Clostridium tetani), found in soil, dust, and animal feces, can lead to a tetanus infection if you don' thave up-to-date immunity. Your best defense against tetanus is prevention by vaccination, because tetanus may be fatal even with treatment. Signs and symptoms of tetanus appear from a few days to several weeks after an injury and include:

 • Muscular irritability
 • Spasms or stiffness of the jaw, neck, and other muscles
 •Fever

 Tetanus is also known as lockjaw because when the toxin spreads to the nerves of muscles, the face and jaw muscles in the area will react with strong spasms. There may also be difficulty swallowing, irritability, and difficulty breathing.
